result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly J. Langlois was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Illegal Articles to Inmate, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 302.095(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact with T. Hoag other than correspondence sent via the US Postal Service. No contact with any Wisconsin Department of Corrections Facility other that the parking lot of any facility that T. Hoag may be incarcerated in. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly J. Langlois

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:54 p.m. Defendant Kelly J. Langlois in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted reading waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 1 - DRI. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding sentencing. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: 60 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, 2 days CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than May 15, 2015, NC w/ T. Hoag other than correspondence sent via the USPS, NC w/ any Wisconsin Department of Corrections Facility other than the parking lot of any facility that T. Hoag may be incarcerated in, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA and follow through, DNA sample and surcharge, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:55 PM: Defendant Kelly J. Langlois in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of time limits.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Initial appearance on March 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity. Defendant is prohibited from having contact with any correctional institution whatsoever.

Case called @ 1:10 p.m. Defendant Kelly J. Langlois in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $2000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $2000 Sig Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
